thread.title: Quaid expected in Vermont court to face charge
thread.title_full: Quaid expected in Vermont court to face charge

title: Quaid expected in Vermont court to face charge
text:
Actor Randy Quaid expected in Vermont court to face charge connected to vandalism case 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS October 12, 2015 - 2:40 am EDT 
HIGHGATE, Vermont â€” Actor Randy Quaid is expected to be arraigned in Vermont in connection with a California vandalism case. 
The 65-year-old Quaid was taken into custody Friday night while trying to cross into the United States from Canada. He was detained by troopers in Vermont after Canadian officials said he'd be deported. In a photo provided by the Vermont State Police, Evi Quaid stands in the Vermont State Police barracks in St. Albans, Vt., Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. Quaid and her husband, actor Randy Qaid, were taken into custody Friday while trying to cross from Canada into the United States. Randy Quaid is wanted in Santa Barbara, Calif., to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. The two skipped several court appearances and went to Canada, where Evi Quaid was granted citizenship. (Vermont State Police via AP) 
Quaid and his wife, Evi, are wanted in Santa Barbara, California, to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after they were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. 
The pair skipped several court appearances and went to Canada, where Evi Quaid was granted citizenship. Randy Quaid's bid for permanent residency was denied. 
Quaid is to appear in court Monday on a fugitive from justice charge. It wasn't immediately known if a hearing will be held for his wife.
